blog.description:
I write fic and I make aesthetic boards. My Ao3 library currently includes:
The Exorcist
Pacific Rim
Fantastic Beasts
Hannibal
Star Trek
and others.
The aesthetics, however, are for all sorts of things. I don't post here too often but I'm online every day and my inbox is always open!

blog.name: nilim
blog.title: The sky may be falling, but the stars look good on you
blog.description:
D&D, Critical Role, Discworld. 
-
I create meta, gifsets, fanart and fanfiction.

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: night-filled-mountain replied to your post: What are some weirdly specific, unlikely or just... I go back and forth on just how...
body:
night-filled-mountain replied to your post: What are some weirdly specific, unlikely or just…

I go back and forth on just how crack-y this is, but I’m still VERY MUCH half-convinced that Jester and Molly (well, Lucien) were half-siblings both fathered by the Gentleman, with Lucien’s mother being Ophelia Mardun. I have an old giant post about it buried somewhere in the depths of my blog. ^^

Oh damn. This one isn’t even half-bad, although it’s still out there on the holy shit-scale, especially if it turns out to be true. I mean… we all know the Gentleman gets around. I wonder how many potential siblings Jester has o_o

Also, this idea becomes hilarious when you consider maybe the Gentleman knew about them beforehand, but then one day two of his kids just straight up walk into his underground lair like they own the place, and they be like that, immediately getting into bar fights, just being loud, overly dramatic, colorful people, drawing every single person’s attention. The Gentleman just hiding his face like, everyone’s going to put two and two together now, I don’t want to deal with this. But no one does, and he can’t shake the nagging feeling it’s not because people are too dumb, but because his men are just humoring him and don’t want to bring up a touchy subject.

On the other hand, it’s incredibly fucking tragic if you consider Jester finding out one day. That lonely girl, who would have given anything to have a sibling to play with, talk with, care for, when she was growing up in that little room of hers. To have that connection. And then she finally finds out… but too late. 

It makes Molly’s death about a million times worse and I hate it, thanks.

What are some weirdly specific, unlikely or just straight up crack headcanons you all have, which you still belief despite a lack of evidence, or even evidence on the contrary?

Mine is that Fjord definitely has/had a younger sibling.
